item.title: Working with Links
item.description:
The Links feature pack enables improved linking workflows.

Revisit recently opened Links

Keep track of links that you have opened from other apps. You can later easily re-open them and add the links to Notes.

Bookmark Links for later

While browsing, you can easily bookmark Links to re-open them later or to add them to Notes.

Add arbitrary Metadata

You can attach arbitrary Metadata to Links in the File Browser. The editor keeps track of used attribute keys and values. Tag your Links, add info-notes, attach related Links. See where the current Link is mentioned in other Metadata.

item.title: Advanced Links
item.description:
Copy your Links to other apps using different title formats. Export compatible Web-Links where necessary. Tapping those Web-Links brings you back to this App.

Title formats

When copying links or appending to a note, Foldie offers to copy the plain link, a formatted version for pasting into a rich text editor and a Markdown version. The latter two require a URL and a title.

This title can be customized in Settings and is a dedicated portion of the URL, such as the file name or the file name without extension.

item.title: Big Band
item.description:
You play the trumpet in the big band “The Reluctant Syncopators”. Your band has PDFs of the scores stored on an online folder. Some PDFs contain all voices (Song.pdf), some are split up into the different voices (Song-trumpet-2.pdf).

Preparing a playlist for a gig

You took over the moderation of the gig, so you do not have much time between the songs. Therefore you prepare a playlist note:

  • You create a new note for the gig and make it the current note.
  • For each song in the gig list:
    • You find the relevant PDF score file.
    • You open it with the built-in PDF viewer.
    • Within the score file you find the starting page of the notes for your voice (trumpet 2).
    • You create a link from the current page and add it to the current note.

During the gig, you just tap the next link from the playlist note to get to the relevant page of the next song.

item.title: Bookmarks
item.description:
While browsing, and in other places where links are active, you can bookmark the links. You can then later look up the bookmarked links using the side bar. Then you can edit the list of bookmarks and mark bookmarks as favorites.

You can perform common actions with each link in the bookmarks list.

item.title: Collaboration
item.description:
You work in a crative team in the company “The fruiters”. Part of your work is creating, talking about and modifying many design documents.

You and your team agree on the following setup and workflow:

  • You all share a single iCloud project folder F with subdirectories Common, Tom, Peter, Anna.
  • Within the subdirectories, your team create reasonable project-specific subfolders.
  • Tom, Peter and Anna first create different documents in their named folders.
  • Then they discuss the documents in a Facetime call.
  • The team puts documents and resources that all agree upon into Common. Now the refinement begins:
  • Tom and Anna each want to work on their own vision for document D.

  • Then they discuss the documents in a Facetime call,

item.title: Link Actions
item.description:
There are many places in Foldie, where a Foldie Links is active:

  • The current location in the file browser.
  • A selected item in the file browser.
  • A selected item in the recents list.
  • A selected item in the bookmark list.
  • A selected item in the host list.

In most places you can use the context menu to perform common actions.

  • If outside of the file browser: Open the link in the file browser.
  • Create a bookmark.
  • Copy the link to clipboard as a Foldie Link or as a Foldie Web Link.
  • Share the link via the system share sheet.
  • Add the link to the current note.
  • Perform shortcut actions.

item.title: Metadata
item.description:
Foldie metadata is inspired from the Resource Description Framework (RDF), but much simpler. A Metadata entry is represented by a subject-predicate-object-triple (Link, Attribute, Value), where Link is a Foldie Link URL, Attribute is a user-defined name such as “tag”, “quality”, “basedOn”, and Value is single- or multiline plain text that may contain other links.

A link property is an (Attribute, Value) pair, and a mention of a link is a metadata entry, in which the link occurs in the value field.

item.title: Notes
item.description:
In notes you can freely mix plain text, links and basic markup. Use notes to create an ordered list of Links or to tell a story. Select a Current Note and easily add Links to it from context menus.

Basic Markup

Foldie supports only a small subset of Markdown:

  • Use **Some text** to make it bold: Some text
  • Use *Some text* to make it italics: Some text
  • Use [Link Title](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page) to create links with arbitrary titles: Link Title.
  • You can use relative paths in links like [Link Title](relative/path.txt), if you set a Base URL in the editor.

Additionally, plain text URLs are detected and turned into tappable links.

item.title: Recents
item.description: Foldie keeps track of links that you have opened from other apps. You can later revisit those links and perform common link actions with them.

item.title: Widgets
item.description:
This app provides widgets that you can add to your home screen, so that you can open some links directly.

A Hosts widget that lists all Foldie Hosts and a Note widget that lists all links of the current note. Both come in different sizes and open the Foldie app, when an item is tapped.
